item.title: Temporary proxy coordinator outage on GCP europe-west4
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: proxy coordinator, local outage, ClickHouse Cloud, GCP europe-west4, failed connections. Summary: The status report indicates that a proxy coordinator experienced a local outage on ClickHouse Cloud GCP europe-west4. This resulted in failed new connections between a specific time frame. The outage affected the company's services and impacted the ability to establish new connections during the outage period. The incident was resolved, and normal operations were restored after the issue was addressed. The outage highlights the importance of monitoring and addressing local outages promptly to minimize the impact on users and business operations. The company will likely review its processes to prevent similar outages in the future. The incident serves as a reminder of the significance of maintaining reliable and stable platforms for uninterrupted service delivery. Summary:

The status report indicates that a proxy coordinator experienced a local outage on ClickHouse Cloud GCP europe-west4. This resulted in failed new connections between a specific time frame. The outage affected the company's services and impacted the ability to establish new connections during the outage period. The incident was resolved, and normal operations were restored after the issue was addressed. The outage highlights the importance of monitoring and addressing local outages promptly to minimize the impact on users and business operations. The company will likely review its processes to prevent similar outages in the future. The incident serves as a reminder of the significance of maintaining reliable and stable platforms for uninterrupted service delivery.

Jan 29, 14:52 UTC
Resolved - A proxy coordinator experienced a local outage on ClickHouse Cloud GCP europe-west4 resulting in failed new connections between 2024-01-29T14:15 and 2024-01-29T14:25

item.title: Dev instances incorrectly resized
item.content:encoded:
Identified, Resolved, Update, GCP, dev services
Summary:
The company has identified an issue with a subset of their development services being resized and plans to resolve it by 12p PST. They have also updated that GCP was impacted and have applied a patch to most regions. The patch has been verified and they are considering this issue resolved.

Jan 18, 20:07 UTC
Resolved - The patch has been applied to all regions and verified. We are considering this resolved.

Jan 18, 20:04 UTC
Update - The patch has been applied to most regions which are marked as operational below.

Jan 18, 17:50 UTC
Update - We've identified that GCP was also impacted.

Jan 18, 17:48 UTC
Identified - A subset of dev services were resized from 8GB to 6GB. The fix has been identified and is expected to be resolved by 12p PST.

item.title: Delay in metering metrics for services on AWS
item.content:encoded:
Dec 23, 22:49 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Usage and billing data from the outage period have been backfilled and are current. Some monitoring metrics from during the outage period may show as reduced or incomplete unfortunately, although these do not impact the usage and billing data. Thanks for your patience during this work, and happy holidays and new years.

Dec 22, 01:33 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented, and we are monitoring the results. Metrics are flowing in properly now, although ClickHouse will still need to backfill some gaps in the usage and billing data.

Dec 21, 22:49 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified, and a fix is being implemented. The delayed data is in the process of being backfilled.

Dec 21, 22:35 UTC
Investigating - ClickHouse Cloud is experiencing delays in the metering data on our metrics cluster for services on AWS. The metering data for today's (Dec 21 2023) compute usage is delayed and not current in the ClickHouse Cloud Console usage and data. ClickHouse is aware of the issue and investigating.

item.title: Instances may stay in provisioning state longer than expected
item.content:encoded:
Dec 18, 10:39 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 18, 09:36 UTC
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Dec 18, 09:35 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Dec 18, 09:34 UTC
Update - The issue has been resolved. New instances in the AWS AP-SOUTH-1 region are provisioned as usual without delays. Services which were provisioned within two past hours will be provisioned soon.

Dec 18, 09:09 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating the reason of the issue.

item.title: STS token failure in AWS leads to ClickHouse Cloud Outage
item.content:encoded:
Dec 18, 04:02 UTC
Resolved - We received confirmation from AWS support that the issue has been resolved, and our monitoring no longer detects any errors. This incident is now considered resolved. For additional details regarding the AWS IAM issue, you can refer to https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status?eventID=arn:aws:health:global::event/IAM/AWS_IAM_OPERATIONAL_ISSUE/AWS_IAM_OPERATIONAL_ISSUE_62881_637B393821C

Dec 18, 03:50 UTC
Monitoring - Our team has validated that the creation of new ClickHouse services is operational across all AWS regions. While awaiting the definitive confirmation from the AWS support team, we will continue to monitor all regions for any potential issues.

Dec 18, 03:36 UTC
Identified - Update: The AWS support team has verified that this issue specifically impacts the creation and modification of IAM roles, users, and policies, with no impact on existing IAM configurations. Our team conducted a thorough check with our internal services, existing customer instances, and observed no disruptions. Consequently, we can deduce that this incident solely affects newly created ClickHouse instances.

Dec 18, 03:19 UTC
Investigating - We have just been informed about a persistent problem affecting the AWS IAM STS token endpoint. This issue has led to disruptions in ClickHouse services for all customers in all AWS regions. Currently, it is not possible to provision new services, and a small number of existing services may experience some disruption. Our team is collaborating with AWS to resolve this issue at the earliest opportunity.

item.title: A subset of keepers nodes hosted on GCP US-east1 has lost connectivity.
item.content:encoded:
Dec 13, 20:03 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 13, 17:27 UTC
Update - All the keepers affected have been recovered. We are continuing to identify the root cause of the issue.

Dec 13, 15:58 UTC
Monitoring - We replaced the nodes and are monitoring the situation. We are still working on identifying the root cause.

Dec 13, 15:57 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Dec 13, 15:54 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating an issue happening in US-east1 in GCP. It appears that a subset of the nodes hosting keepers has temporarily lost connectivity, and we are investigating the root cause.

item.title: Metrics charts may be unavailable in Control Plane
item.content:encoded:
Dec 8, 08:29 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 7, 18:10 UTC
Monitoring - Issues resolved. Metrics should be available for all services in all regions.

Dec 7, 12:51 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Dec 7, 11:47 UTC
Investigating - Metrics charts in UI may be unavailable.
ClickHouse services are completely operational in all affected regions.

item.title: ClickHouse Cloud permissions errors
item.content:encoded:
Nov 17, 20:06 UTC
Resolved - After investigation and identification, this incident has been resolved. As noted previously, this new permissions checking in ClickHouse 23.9 is a better and more proper method of ensuring grants on these uses of asynchronous inserts and dictionaries. In order to properly apply these grants, please refer to the following ClickHouse Knowledge Base (KB) article:
https://clickhouse.com/docs/knowledgebase/ingest-failures-23-9-release

We apologize for any interruption from this change in behavior, as it should have been better communicated prior to the release. If you require any additional assistance with updating your user grants in ClickHouse Cloud, please reach out to ClickHouse Support via a new case or chat:
https://clickhouse.cloud/support

Nov 17, 19:57 UTC
Monitoring - As noted, the workaround for this new behavior in ClickHouse 23.9 is described in more detail in the following KB article:
https://clickhouse.com/docs/knowledgebase/ingest-failures-23-9-release

If you require any additional assistance in updating your user grants in ClickHouse Cloud, please reach out to ClickHouse Support via a new case or chat:
https://clickhouse.cloud/support

Nov 17, 19:53 UTC
Identified - The root cause of these permissions errors has been identified and is due to more strict checking of grants for asynchronous inserts and dictionaries in the 23.9 release. If you are using a non-default user with limited permissions to perform asynchronous inserts or dictionary creation, you must apply additional grants to this user.

The workaround for this issue is described in more detail in the following KB article: https://clickhouse.com/docs/knowledgebase/ingest-failures-23-9-release

Nov 17, 18:18 UTC
Investigating - ClickHouse has been alerted to user-level database 4xx permissions errors in ClickHouse Cloud and is actively investigating the issue

item.title: ClickHouse Cloud SQL Console is not loading
item.content:encoded:
Nov 8, 22:42 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved. There was a problem with a load balancer service - this is now fixed, and the Cloud team is investigating how to prevent such incidents in the future. This incident affected only the SQL Console, and other methods of connecting to ClickHouse Cloud services via the ClickHouse Native SSL/TLS protocol (port 9440) or HTTPS protocol (8443) were unaffected. We apologize for any disruption.

Nov 8, 21:14 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Nov 8, 21:14 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Nov 8, 21:07 UTC
Investigating - ClickHouse has been alerted to an issue with the SQL Console. Cloud users receive an error of "503 Service Temporarily Unavailable" when attempting to access or use the SQL Console. We are actively investigating the scope and cause of this issue, and we will update here once we have more information.

item.title: SQLConsole is not opening
item.content:encoded:
Nov 6, 15:29 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 6, 15:07 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Nov 6, 14:24 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

item.title: ClickHouse SQL Console not Loading
item.content:encoded:
Oct 19, 10:41 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Oct 19, 10:30 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating an issue with the ClickHouse SQL console not loading. All other clients should be able to connect to your Clickhouse cloud service.

item.title: GCP regions offline
item.content:encoded:
Sep 22, 23:00 UTC
Resolved - Our alert system detected a disruption in GCP hosted instances at 10:45 pm UTC. Our engineering team promptly initiated an investigation and identified that the problem stemmed from the ongoing incident on the GCP platform. Subsequently, we escalated the matter to GCP support by opening a Priority 1 support case. This issue is now resolved and all systems are operational

item.title: Authentification Issue When Using the Developer Role
item.content:encoded:
Sep 11, 13:47 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Sep 11, 11:29 UTC
Identified - SQL Cloud Console is currently affected by an authentication issue preventing access to databases when using a developer role. The root cause has been identified, and a fix is being worked on and released as soon as possible.

item.title: ClickHouse Cloud Usage Summary Page is inaccessible
item.content:encoded:
Aug 25, 10:21 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Aug 25, 03:35 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating the issue where customers cannot access ClickHouse Cloud Usage Summary Page.

item.title: ClickHouse Cloud UI is not accessible
item.content:encoded:
Jun 18, 06:35 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jun 18, 06:27 UTC
Monitoring - We have rectified the issue and seeing our ControlPlane recovering.

Jun 18, 06:00 UTC
Identified - Please note that all customers ClickHouse instances are operational - Only the ClickHouse Cloud UI is suffering a temporary outage. We have identified the issue and escalating to the relevant team.

Jun 18, 05:59 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating the issue where customers cannot access ClickHouse Cloud UI

item.title: Upstream AWS incident in US-East-1 in impacting ClickHouse Cloud services
item.content:encoded:
Jun 13, 21:36 UTC
Resolved - ClickHouse has completed its testing and the issue looks resolved - no further issues or errors are observed for the US-East-1 region

Jun 13, 20:53 UTC
Monitoring - AWS is reporting the fix has been implemented and they are seeing reduced errors. AWS is monitoring recovery. ClickHouse is testing and monitoring recovery.

Jun 13, 20:10 UTC
Identified - The issues in US-East-1 have been identified as related to the AWS upstream degradation at AWS. AWS is reporting that they have identified the root cause as an issue with AWS Lambda and are working on resolution https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status

Jun 13, 19:42 UTC
Investigating - ClickHouse is currently investigating an issue with service management in AWS region US-East-1. We believe this is due to an issue with upstream provider AWS as reported here:
https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status
https://status.aws.amazon.com/rss/multipleservices-us-east-1.rss

Operational issue - Multiple services (N. Virginia)
Affected AWS services
The following AWS services have been affected by this issue. Degradation (3 services)
* AWS CloudFormation
* AWS Lambda
* Amazon Connect

ClickHouse Services impacted in US-East-1 include Control Plane functions such as the Cloud console, service creation or deletion, user management, API, usage metrics and billing.

item.title: SQL console unavailable
item.content:encoded:
May 13, 12:00 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

item.title: Authentication issue with the SQL Console
item.content:encoded:
Apr 21, 02:06 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Apr 21, 01:50 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and deployed and we are monitoring the results.

Apr 21, 01:31 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being rolled out. It is estimated that it will take about 30 minutes for all errors to be cleared.

Apr 21, 01:18 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Apr 21, 01:13 UTC
Investigating - We have identified a problem with the SQL Console in ClickHouse Cloud. The SQL Console is requiring a user to enter their user credentials (username + password), when normally the SQL Console is automatically authenticated to a user's database. The workaround is to manually enter your credentials. We are investigating the problem and will roll out a fix as soon as possible.

item.title: Previously-created UDF inaccessible
item.content:encoded:
Apr 13, 00:55 UTC
Resolved - The rollout is over and all previously created UDF should be accessible.

Apr 13, 00:03 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are rolling out the patch.

Apr 12, 21:51 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Apr 12, 21:50 UTC
Identified - We are currently investigating an issue where previously-created UDFs cannot be accessed after the latest ClickHouse Cloud release (v23.3). Any UDFs created after the update are unaffected.

item.title: Error in the SQL console
item.content:encoded:
Apr 11, 14:29 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Apr 11, 14:26 UTC
Identified - We have identified the issue and are working towards resolving it.

Apr 11, 14:23 UTC
Update - We are currently troubleshooting an issue with the SQL console being unavailable for users based out of Europe. The error returned is the following: {"error":"Unexpected token < in JSON at position 0"}

Apr 11, 14:08 UTC
Investigating - We are currently troubleshooting an issue with the SQL console being unavailable for a subset of users. The error returned is the following: {"error":"Unexpected token < in JSON at position 0"}

item.title: Auto-scaling slider issue
item.content:encoded:
Mar 7, 23:45 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved. After further investigation, we found the impact was limited to only a few services, and all services are now set back to their previous scaler setting. If you have any questions, please contact ClickHouse Support at https://clickhouse.cloud/support

Mar 7, 23:18 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented in all regions, and we are monitoring the results.

Mar 7, 22:30 UTC
Identified - ClickHouse Cloud has identified an issue with our auto-scaling process in all regions. For services which had not manually adjusted their auto-scaler slider and were using the default (and which were not currently idled), those services could have had their scaler sizing reduced by this issue. We are actively pushing out a fix to all regions now.

item.title: HTTP query failures
item.content:encoded:
Feb 28, 02:00 UTC
Resolved - A configuration error caused query failures on the HTTP interface. This issue was investigated and resolved

item.title: us-west-2 region offline
item.content:encoded:
Feb 4, 01:26 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 4, 01:22 UTC
Investigating - At 4:04PM PST we detected US-West-2 Region was down. After investigating and applying a fix service restoration was confirmed at 5:05PM PST. Customers in the us-west-2 region may have experienced connectivity issues and service restarts.

item.title: Incorrect Backup Status
item.content:encoded:
Feb 3, 13:15 UTC
Resolved - The fix has been rolled out to all regions successfully. Status for all affected backups is updated and available in Control Plane. This incident has been resolved.

Feb 3, 11:48 UTC
Update - A fix has been implemented and we are in the process of rolling it out to all regions. We are monitoring the results and will provide regular updates.

Feb 3, 08:21 UTC
Identified - The problem with UI displaying incorrect backup status has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Feb 3, 08:14 UTC
Investigating - All services are displaying incorrect backup status of "In Progress" for backups triggered February 1st or later. The actual backups have been taken and only the status in the UI is impacted. We have identified the problem and are working on a fix.
